alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 9:14PM EDT until May 09 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. .Recent rain and snowfall have resulted in river rises on the East Branch of the Escanaba River at Gwinn. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low lying areas of Peter Nordeen Park begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:25 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:25 PM EDT Wednesday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 5.7 feet early Friday morning. It will then rise above flood stage Saturday evening to 7.3 feet Monday morning. It will fall below flood stage again early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 04/17/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 1200 PM EDT.
